title: UN offers 'roadmap' to reducing plastic pollution by 80% by 2040 - Fox Weather
summary: The UN Environment Programme (UNEP) recently released a report presenting a roadmap for achieving an 80% reduction in plastic pollution by 2040 through a shift to a circular economy. By embracing a circular economy model, the report estimates that $1.27 trillion in cost savings can be realized, with a further $3.25 trillion saved by avoiding environmental damage and litigation. Shifting to a circular economy would also have positive employment impacts, with an estimated 700,000 new jobs created by 2040, particularly in low-income countries.

title: End-of-life Recycling in the Fashion Industry | BCG - BCG
summary: The fashion industry generates a significant amount of textile waste, and there are several gaps in the end-of-life value chain that prevent circularity. To address these challenges, the industry must mobilize demand for recycled output, adopt investment models that accelerate expansion, underpin recycling with sorting infrastructure and technology, maximize impact through concerted efforts, and build momentum by starting today. Companies with a clearly defined and well-executed circularity and sustainability agenda stand to win through incremental revenues, decreased costs, reduced reliance on virgin materials, improved supply-chain control, greater risk resilience, enhanced strategic positioning, and a more favorable brand perception.

title: Uzbekistan is stepping up efforts to use innovation as a driver for the circular economy transition - UNECE

title: 12 May: Earth Overshoot Day - Endesa
summary: Spain's Country Overshoot Day was May 12, 2023, meaning the country has used up all the resources that the planet can renew in a year. This date has been getting earlier each year, indicating that our current consumption model is unsustainable. The pressure on the planet is mainly due to human activities such as the increase in greenhouse gas emissions, deforestation, and agricultural overexploitation.

title: Union Minister Hardeep S Puri launches mega campaign 'Meri LiFE, Mera Swachh Shehar'. - Etemaad
summary: The Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs in India has launched a new campaign called ‘Meri LiFE, Mera Swachh Shehar’ to promote the concept of Reduce, Reuse, and Recycle (RRR) for waste management.
